thig14.1:0.3: Verses of the Elder Subhā of Jīvaka’s Mango Grove
thig14.1:1.1: To the charming mango grove Jīvaka,
thig14.1:2.1: "Have I done something to offend you,
thig14.1:2.2: that you stand there holding me aback?
thig14.1:2.3: Because it is not proper, oh friend,
thig14.1:2.4: for a layperson to touch one who has gone forth.
thig14.1:3.1: That is a heavy transgression for me in the dispensation of the Teacher,
thig14.1:3.2: whatever trainings have been expounded by the one faring well.
thig14.1:3.3: I have reached the blameless state of purification,
thig14.1:3.4: why do you stand there holding me aback?
thig14.1:4.1: The stirred up mind is now undisturbed,
thig14.1:4.2: what was dusty is now free from impurity, blameless,
thig14.1:4.4: why do you stand there holding me aback?"
thig14.1:5.2: what can going forth do for you?
thig14.1:5.3: Get rid of that ochre robe,
thig14.1:5.4: come enjoy yourself in this fully blown forest.
thig14.1:6.1: Sweet trees have arisen with flower pollen,
thig14.1:6.4: come, we will delight in this fully blown forest.
thig14.1:7.1: From the top of the blooming mountain and from a tree,
thig14.1:7.3: What will enjoyment become for you,
thig14.1:7.4: if alone you descend in the forest?
thig14.1:8.1: Encircled by a multitude of beasts and snakes,
thig14.1:8.2: stirred up by a She-Elephant the size of a full grown elephant.
thig14.1:8.3: Who would wish to go without friends,
thig14.1:8.4: all alone in this dreadful Mahāvana forest?
thig14.1:9.1: A doll made of shining gold,
thig14.1:9.2: you move about like a nymph in a beautiful grove.
thig14.1:9.3: You look beautiful, with lovely exquisite cloth from Kāsi,
thig14.1:10.1: I would be under your control,
thig14.1:10.2: if you stay with me in crossing the forest,
thig14.1:10.3: because there is no one more dear than you,
thig14.1:10.4: a creature with the soft eyes of a Dryad.
thig14.1:11.1: If you were to pronounce the words:
thig14.1:11.4: you will have women attending you.
thig14.1:12.1: Wearing the finest linen from Kāsi,
thig14.1:12.2: pay attention to the colored garland.
thig14.1:12.3: I will give to you manifold ornaments,
thig14.1:13.1: A bright cover well washed and free from dust,
thig14.1:13.2: new mat wool bedding with long fleece.
thig14.1:13.3: Rise up to that very precious bed,
thig14.1:13.4: adorned with sandalwood, with the most excellent fragrance.
thig14.1:14.1: A blue lotus arisen from the water,
thig14.1:14.2: like the one used by non humans,
thig14.1:14.3: thus you living the holy life,
thig14.1:14.4: your hair and limbs will become decayed."
thig14.1:15.1: "What here do you consider of value,
thig14.1:15.2: in a growing cemetery full of corpses?
thig14.1:15.4: which having seen you look at consternated.??"
thig14.1:16.2: crossing over the mountain like dryads.
thig14.1:16.4: attachment for sensual pleasures grows exceedingly.
thig14.1:17.1: Your eyes are like the crest of a blue lotus,
thig14.1:17.2: on the face like clean gold.
thig14.1:17.4: the string sensual pleasures grows exceedingly.
thig14.1:18.1: Even if we will be far away,
thig14.1:18.2: we'll remember seeing clearly those lashes
thig14.1:18.3: because there is no one more dear than you,
thig14.1:18.4: eyes with the soft eyes of a Dryad."
thig14.1:19.1: "You want to proceed in a wrong way,
thig14.1:19.2: you strive after the moon like it were a toy.
thig14.1:19.3: You want to jump over Mount Meru,
thig14.1:19.4: hunting for one who has heard the teachings of the Buddha.
thig14.1:20.1: Indeed there is not in this world together with all its Devas,
thig14.1:20.2: where craving now could be for me.
thig14.1:20.3: What is it like? I do not know,
thig14.1:20.4: it has been uprooted thanks to the path.
thig14.1:21.2: destroyed like a bowl of poison deserves.
thig14.1:21.3: What is it like? I do not see,
thig14.1:21.4: it has been uprooted thanks to the path.
thig14.1:22.2: or may not have attended the teaching,
thig14.1:22.3: you having enticed of such quality,
thig14.1:22.4: knowing thus this person is vexed.
thig14.1:23.1: Because to me whether reviled or respected,
thig14.1:23.2: served by suffering or happiness, I am mindful.
thig14.1:23.4: everywhere the mind is not stained.
